name: Hotel Elegante Conference & Event Center

reviews.text: Coming from a big city, I was very pleasantly surprised by the nice friendly staff at this hotel. In fact, almost all the strangers I met in Colorado Springs were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: Here are a few things you might find helpful:
reviews.title: Conference Stay

reviews.text: - Location of hotel: Very easy to access from High Way I-25. When you take the exit at Lake Ave/S. Circle Drive, make a left at the light, and then an IMMEDIATELY left. The Crowne Plaza sign is not easy to see at all. (The Days Inn sign is much more visible, but if you see it, you've already gone too far.)
reviews.title: Good Conference Hotel

reviews.text: - Drive to the nearest entrance to your hotel room. This hotel spreads out a lot, and has many entrances, labeled alphabetically. It's best to drive to the nearest entrance from the outside, rather than navigate yourself inside the building, which is like a maze. (I got lost every time trying to do that.)
reviews.title: Horseless Carriage 75th anniversary rallyu

reviews.text: - Self parking is free.
reviews.title: More Conference Center Than Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights (June 27 & 28) and absolutely loved the Crowne Plaza! Everything looks (and maybe is) brand-new, from the dazzling carpets throughout to the flat-screen TVs and oh-so-comfy beds. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient, but so was everyone else working in the hotel that we met, from maids to the man painting a hallway. Our son loved the indoor and outdoor pools. Food was good and the bar was a great way to shake off the trail dust at the end of the day. We loved our stay in this sparkling, immaculate hotel and will be back!
reviews.title: Sparkles like brand-new

reviews.text: Everything seems right about this place. It’s well designed, comfortable, well run. Everybody on the staff is friendly; everybody is on the look out for ways to help you, whether it’s their job or not. If my toilet had broken I think I could have told the chef in the kitchen and he would have said “Don’t worry, sir, I‘m going to make sure that’s taken care of right away.” I’m not sure I have ever stayed at a place that was so universally cheerful, helpful, and problem-free. If I have, then it was three times as expensive.
reviews.title: Delightful!
Bad to good
reviews.text: That was my personal stay. I also was coordinating a small Army reunion. I’ve been doing this for about ten years and I’ve never seen anybody work so hard at getting providing everything the group needed including staying within a very tight budget. World War II veterans are leaving us at a rapid rate, so our group had declined to under 20 by the time we actually arrived. You would have thought we were paying for 400, the way they hopped to make sure every detail was worked out. We asked for several items that I’m sure they could have charged us for according to the contract, but for them it was less important to manage revenue than it was to make sure the customer was happy with everything.
I recommend the Crowne Plaza wholeheartedly.
reviews.title: Exellent Hotel

reviews.text: My sister, mother and I had been on a long road trip and landed at the hotel Thursday evening. We had a problem with our sliding door, so we moved to another room. We had another issue with the room. Why we were tired and not happy about this, we did not want to move rooms again. The staff was very nice, and bent over backwards to correct the problem. The staff were very friendly and in the end we enjoyed our stay. The beds were very comfortable, and we all were able to get the rest we needed. This could have been a bad review if not for the great customer service. The restaurant was very good as well. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Overall very good

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights. The staff was great. We had an issue with a wet floor/carpet just outside the bathroom of our first room and they immediately moved us to a nicer/bigger room and threw in free breakfast buffet for our family. Even though we were only in the first room for 5-10 minutes, it was by the pool and we could hear kids screaming/playing in it. We would recommend to NOT get a room by the pool. The second room we were moved to was clean and spacious - and far away from the pool (it was quiet). We also got to spin "the wheel" for being a priority club member and got a free in room movie, which the kids loved. The hotel location was close to many Colorado Springs points of interest and plenty of places to eat/shop. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: It was nice. Staff was great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff made this place great (once we got out of a B&B designed for hobbits.) It's a big place with lots of convention activity, but the staff worked really hard to be sure we had a nice stay in Colorado Springs..
reviews.title: Staff works hard!

reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights, May 23-26, 2012. Our room was a king and was very roomy, overlooking the indoor pool area. Room has a fridge, microwave, and Keurig coffee maker. Wifi is free and works well. there is a dresser, a desk and a side chair. Great water pressure in the shower!! We ate in Thibodeaux,s, had the buffet which was good. The checkin did take a little longer than I liked, but the staff was very friendly, and it is apparent that customer sat is important to them. It is an older hotel, so it's not the best looking place on the outside, but that wasn't a problem for me. They have an indoor & outdoor pool, which we didn't use. Everything in the room was very clean. We would definitely stay here again, (depending on price, of course)
reviews.title: Ver nice stay

reviews.text: The previous reviews I have read here on TA are pretty much spot on. The checkin takes longer than expected. The rooms are nice but narrow. The public areas need more TLC...
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: The hotel is spread out with lots of hallway carpet..Hey guys ..someone needs to vacuum this carpet every day!!!!
reviews.title: Nice new extras

reviews.text: Stayed here with family and DOGS. This was during the Waldo Canyon fire in CS--further north. The staff was amazing. Considering that 32,000 people evacuated from their homes, the staff was on overdrive. I personally saw the concierges console and comfort people, create wait lists for those who needed rooms or to continue to stay, and juggle everything they were doing to make sure those who needed to stay could. There were at least two conventions in the hotel while we were there, and the hotel is busy and efficient. The hotel has been upgraded at some recent point; the pool areas are very nice (I wouldn't stay in the rooms near the indoor pool--noisy as you would expect with children); the bar is cozy and has great service; the restaurant is okay foodwise but well-staffed and run by attentive people. There is a fenced in dog play-park with doggy bags provided, plus an excellent fitness center (for the humans) with good machines, free weights, refrigerated wet towels, TV, etc. Excellent beds, A/C, flat-screen TV, coffee machine (like a Keuria). This isn't a resort hotel, but we had a nice vacay for a weekend. By the way--one thing that is notable: like at the Broadmoor, as a guest you will never pass a staff member without being greeted with a smile and a "hello, good morning," etc. Friendly and willing staff! Thank you!
reviews.title: Hotel is very good; the staff makes it excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at CP hotel. The room was huge, the bed comfortable, the linens very nice. I asked for a quite room and we got assigned to their "quite zone", it's a floor with no kids, no large groups etc. It was indeed very quite there! It's a genius idea, why don't more hotels come up with this?! The room looked like it was recently renovated and the housekeeping did a great job.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also very close to the freeway, so it's great for exploring the area. We actually had a room overlooking the freeway and we couldn't hear anything but a very slight dim noise that wasn't distracting at all. I am a very light sleeper and if that didn't bother me I believe it wouldn't bother anybody else.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly, a Bit Outdated.

reviews.text: A couple of minor negatives, the bathroom is very small and the sink and counter are outside the bathroom. I am not a fan of that kind of a layout but I can see how it can appeal to others. One night I asked for an extra blanket and had to wait over 40 mins! That's unacceptable to me, the same request in another hotel in Colorado resulted in less than 5 mins wait, now that's good customer service, CP staff should be faster to respond to simple requests like that. The pools (indoor and outdoor) are very small, would've been nice to swim in a bigger pool considering how hot it was during the day.
reviews.title: Great hotel with a wonderful staff!

reviews.text: Overall it's a solid 3.5 star hotel and offers good value.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

aka: Crowne Plaza Colorado Springs Hotel Colorado Springs
description: Hotel Elegante Conference & Event Center features 500 rooms and suites and has undergone a multi-million dollor renovation which includes all-new 13" Simmons BeautyRest mattresses in ALL rooms, the addition of a Starbuck's "We Proudly Brew" Sweet Tooth and Blue Bell Ice Cream parlor. Our rooms feature Bath and Body works amenities and Starbuck's coffee. Enjoy our children's playground featuring the Fun Zone for all ages. Get fit in our 24 hour fitness center and new Sports Court featuring tennis, pickleball, volleyball and basketball. Our Patio Bar is now open with outdoor seating and fireplace. In addition, there are two pools, one indoor and one outdoor. The hotel's newly themed restaurants include Rustler's Country Cafe - Steak & Seafood, and Rawhide Sports Bar. Hotel Elegante Conference & Event Center is a premier Colorado Springs meeting and event location with 50,000 sq. ft. of meeting space.
